thread.title: FONTANA: Alzheimer’s patient to be reunited with family (UPDATE)
thread.title_full: FONTANA: Alzheimer’s patient to be reunited with family (UPDATE) - Press Enterprise

author: NIKIE JOHNSON
title: FONTANA: Alzheimer’s patient to be reunited with family (UPDATE)
text:
BY NIKIE JOHNSON 7, 2015 Updated: 4:50 p.m. FONTANA: Alzheimer’s patient to be reunited with family (UPDATE) HUGO CISNEROS COURTESY OF FONTANA POLICE Related article » A Los Angeles-area man with Alzheimer's who ended up in San Bernardino County on Monday will be reunited with his family after media reports helped them find him.
Hugo Cisneros, 67, was supposed to take the train from Los Angeles to Fontana, but became disoriented and ended up in Ontario on Monday night, Fontana police said in a news release.
A good Samaritan picked him up, and when Cisneros indicated he might live in Fontana, the good Samaritan drove him there and flagged down a police officer. Cisneros was taken into the care of social services.
On Wednesday, Oct. 7, when Fontana police had not been able to locate Cisneros' family, they put out a news release and took to social media, asking for the public's help.
His family, who had been searching for him since Monday, saw his picture and went to the Fontana police station to claim him, police said.
